faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens face no limitations, while non-EU buyers typically require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE). The process is straightforward with professional legal assistance. Many international buyers successfully purchase in Villajoyosa, and MARGEVS can recommend experienced English-speaking legal advisors to guide you through the purchase process.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property price, expect additional costs including transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). Total acquisition costs typically range from 8-13% of the purchase price. Our team provides detailed cost breakdowns for RAMBLA BEACH II, ensuring no surprises during your purchase journey.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase does not require a visa. However, visa requirements depend on your nationality and intended residency. EU citizens have freedom of movement and can reside indefinitely. Non-EU citizens should consult Spanish immigration requirements. Property ownership is separate from residency status, so you can purchase regardless of visa classification.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spanish property taxes include annual council tax (IBI) typically ranging from 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, and wealth tax (up to 3.75% for high-value properties, though many regions exempt primary residences). Rental income is subject to income tax. Our advisors provide detailed tax planning for RAMBLA BEACH II purchases, helping you understand annual obligations.
